techniques.name: X-ray diffraction
techniques.parameters: 130 K, 200 K, and 330 K; Mo Kα radiation

challenge.description: Formation of mainly three twin components inside the crystal during structural analysis.
challenge.impact: The presence of twin components complicates the accurate measurement of intensity data and structural refinement.

solution.description: A slow cooling rate of 0.05 K/min was applied to obtain a single-domain specimen with orthorhombic symmetry.
solution.methodology: Controlled cooling process to reduce twinning effects.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully allowed the measurement of intensity data from a single-domain specimen, enabling accurate structural analysis.

evidence.data: The intensity data of mainly single-domain specimens were successfully measured after applying the slow cooling rate.

context.material_properties: Orthorhombic symmetry at low temperatures with a 3a × 3a × a superstructure.
context.experimental_conditions: Slow cooling rate of 0.05 K/min during crystal preparation.
context.application_relevance: Accurate structural characterization is critical for understanding the material's phase transitions and potential applications in lithium-ion batteries.
